meanings.definition: Indistinct or hazy in outline or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The picture was the blurriest of all, making it hard to recognize anyone in it.
meanings.sent2: The fog made everything look blurrier than usual, causing a sense of mystery.
meanings.sent3: The artist accidentally created the blurriest painting ever, turning it into an abstract masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: Her memory of that day was the blurriest, like trying to recall a dream upon waking.
meanings.sent5: The blurriest details of the landscape faded into the distance, creating a dreamlike scene.

meanings.definition: To make or become unclear or less distinct.
meanings.sent1: The rain started to blur the lines on the paper, making the text blurriest.
meanings.sent2: As time passed, the ink began to blur, making the writing blurrier and blurrier.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to blurriest the boundaries between reality and illusion.
meanings.sent4: The tears in her eyes threatened to blurriest the image of his face in her memory.
meanings.sent5: The fog began to blurriest the edges of the forest, creating an eerie atmosphere.
